C3: Create a cheat sheet. Considers the given draw options object.
Print the points whose ranks are given in the vector $v$.
Print the lines whose ranks are given in the vector $v$.
Determine the rank of the line through the points whose ranks are $p1$ and $p2$.
Create the ranks of all lines through the point whose rank is $p$.
Determine the common perp of a set of points. The point ranks are given in the list $L$.
Create a csv file with the point line incidence matrix of the space.
Find the points in the intersection of the quadric with the subspace whose generating matrix has label $M$.
Export a table of BLT-sets. We must be in an $Q^4(q)$ space.
Create the orthogonal reflections associated with the given set of points, encoded as a vector. The points must be off the quadric. The points are given as point ranks in projective space.

Create the Siegel transformation defined by the vectors $u$ and $v$. The Siegel transformation is defined as $\rho_{u,v}(x) := x + \beta(x,v) u - \beta(x,u) v - Q(v) \beta(x,u) u.$  Here, $Q$ is the quadratic form and $\beta$ is the associated bilinear form. The vector $u$ must be singular and $v$ must be in $u^\perp.$
Make all Siegel transformations by looping over all possible pairs for $u$ and $v$.
Create the orthogonal reflections associated with the given set of point. Once done, turn the mappings into mappings of $\PG(3,q)$, using the action A4.
